author: Kevin Bogardus
title: Regan touts support for embattled Biden - E&E News by POLITICO
text: EPA Administrator Michael Regan offered a message of support for President Joe Biden as questions swirl around the president’s reelection bid. Biden has faced calls to drop out of the race from members of his own party after delivering a poor debate performance against former President Donald Trump last month. Since then, Cabinet officials’ comments about the president are being scrutinized as Democrats are locked in fierce infighting about whether he should remain the party’s 2024 presidential nominee. “I continued to be inspired by [@POTUS](https://x.com/POTUS)’ leadership,” Regan said in [a social media post](https://x.com/EPAMichaelRegan/status/1813955295300682174?ref_src=twsrc%5Egoogle%7Ctwcamp%5Eserp%7Ctwgr%5Etweet) Thursday morning. “Every day, I’m proud to serve in an Administration that prioritizes AND invests in Black communities.” The administrator also shared a photo of the president, which appears to be from Biden’s speech before the NAACP national convention Tuesday. Regan also spoke at the meeting earlier this week.

author: Julian Cruz
title: NorthWestern Energy's Strategic Partnership with Quantica Infrastructure: A Catalyst for Utility Valuation and Grid Efficiency in the Decarbonization Era
text:
NorthWestern Energy's Strategic Partnership with Quantica Infrastructure: A Catalyst for Utility Valuation and Grid Efficiency in the Decarbonization Era
In a world where artificial intelligence and digital infrastructure are reshaping global economies, NorthWestern Energy Group, Inc. (NWE) has positioned itself at the forefront of a transformative energy paradigm. The company's recent nonbinding letter of intent with Quantica Infrastructure—a developer of integrated digital infrastructure solutions—signals a bold move to align its energy portfolio with the surging demand for high-capacity, low-carbon power. This partnership, centered on supporting a 500-megawatt data center development in Montana with potential growth to 1 gigawatt by 2030, exemplifies how utilities can leverage large-scale energy contracts to drive stock valuation, infrastructure efficiency, and decarbonization in a rapidly evolving energy landscape.
The Strategic Imperative: Data Centers as a Growth Engine
The data center boom, fueled by AI and hyperscale computing, is creating a seismic shift in energy demand. By 2030, data centers are projected to consume 11–15% of U.S. electricity, up from 6–8% in 2024. For utilities like NorthWestern Energy, this represents both a challenge and an opportunity. By securing long-term, high-load contracts with data center operators, utilities can stabilize revenue streams while accelerating investments in grid modernization and renewable energy.
Quantica's proposed development in Montana—backed by EnCap Investments—offers NWE a unique chance to monetize its existing infrastructure. The project's phased growth plan, contingent on permitting and infrastructure development, allows NWE to scale its energy services incrementally, reducing financial risk while capturing value from a customer base with predictable, high-margin demand. This model mirrors successful strategies employed by peers like Vistra and GE Vernova, whose stock prices surged in 2024 due to similar data center contracts.
Infrastructure Efficiency and Cost Optimization
A critical factor in NWE's approach is the potential to spread fixed infrastructure costs across a broader customer base. By delivering energy services through its regulated utility operations, NWE aims to reduce per-unit costs for both itself and its customers. This aligns with broader industry trends where utilities are rethinking tariff structures to shift costs from residential ratepayers to large commercial users. For example, AEP Ohio and Duke Energy have introduced clean transition tariffs to incentivize renewable energy investments while ensuring cost recovery from data centers.
The partnership also underscores the importance of grid flexibility. NWE's transmission study, which evaluates a mix of renewable and on-demand generation resources, reflects a balanced strategy to meet data center needs without over-reliance on fossil fuels. This approach not only supports decarbonization but also mitigates regulatory and environmental risks. For instance, Georgia Power's recent approval to extend coal plant operations and build new gas facilities highlights the pragmatic balance utilities must strike between reliability and sustainability.
Decarbonization and the Role of Nuclear and Renewables
As the energy sector transitions to net-zero, NorthWestern Energy's collaboration with Quantica aligns with a global trend: the integration of clean baseload power into data center operations. Microsoft's partnership with Constellation Energy—supplying power from a nuclear plant set to restart in 2029—demonstrates the growing appeal of nuclear energy for carbon-intensive industries. Similarly, NWE's focus on Montana's clean energy portfolio (including wind and solar) positions it to meet the sustainability goals of tech giants while diversifying its generation mix.
Renewable energy contracts for data centers have already reached 34 GW in the U.S. by 2024, with projections of 41 GW by 2030. NWE's strategic acquisition of Energy West's natural gas distribution system in Montana further strengthens its ability to manage energy transitions, balancing immediate reliability needs with long-term decarbonization targets.
Regulatory and Workforce Challenges
The path to decarbonization is not without hurdles. NWE's ongoing rate review in Montana and the implementation of Senate Bill 301—which aims to expedite transmission line construction—highlight the regulatory complexities utilities face. These challenges underscore the need for proactive stakeholder engagement and policy alignment. Additionally, the shortage of skilled labor for grid upgrades and renewable projects remains a bottleneck. Utilities must invest in workforce development to ensure they can deliver on their commitments to data center operators and decarbonization goals.
Investment Implications
For investors, NorthWestern Energy's partnership with Quantica Infrastructure presents a compelling case. The company's strategic focus on scalable, low-carbon energy solutions aligns with the long-term trajectory of the utility sector. By leveraging its existing infrastructure, expanding into new markets, and capitalizing on regulatory tailwinds, NWE is well-positioned to outperform peers.
Key metrics to monitor include NWE's progress in securing permits for the Quantica project, the outcomes of its transmission study, and its ability to integrate renewable energy into its generation mix. Investors should also watch for shifts in utility stock valuations as data center demand continues to drive growth.
Conclusion
NorthWestern Energy's collaboration with Quantica Infrastructure is more than a business transaction—it is a blueprint for how utilities can thrive in a decarbonizing economy. By aligning with data center operators, optimizing infrastructure efficiency, and embracing clean energy, NWE is not only securing its financial future but also contributing to the broader energy transition. As the digital economy's energy demands continue to rise, utilities that adapt with innovation and foresight will emerge as leaders, offering investors both resilience and growth potential.
For those seeking exposure to this transformative trend, NorthWestern Energy's stock represents a strategic play in the convergence of energy, technology, and sustainability. The key lies in monitoring its execution of the Quantica partnership and its ability to navigate regulatory and operational challenges—factors that will ultimately determine its success in the new energy era.

topics: Economy, Business and Finance->business strategy and marketing

author: Alice Ledauphin
title: Glycémie : manger ce fruit au petit-déjeuner "peut faire plus de mal que de bien"
text: Premier repas de la journée, le petit-déjeuner permet d'éviter les coups de fatigue et les fringales jusqu'au midi. Chacun a ses petites habitudes : tartines de confiture, bol de céréales, fromage blanc agrémenté de fruits... Mais certains choix sont plutôt déconseillés car ils peuvent augmenter la glycémie. Il correspond au taux de glucose dans le sang, une source d'énergie essentielle pour notre corps. Lors d'un pic de glycémie, ce taux s'élève trop rapidement et provoque un coup de mou, une fatigue, voire une sensation de malaise. C'est particulièrement vrai en mangeant ce fruit, pourtant plebiscité dans les recettes de petit-déjeuners. Dans une vidéo, le Dr Saurabh Sethi, gastro-entérologue en Californie (Etats-Unis) explique que ce fruit très populaire au petit-déjeuner est à éviter en smoothie par exemple. Déjà parce qu'il pourrait "réduire les bienfaits antioxydants" des autres fruits et aussi parce qu'il augmente "la charge en glucides simples de votre smoothie, ce qui peut entraîner des pics rapides de sucre dans le sang". De quel fruit s'agit-il ? Tout simplement de la banane. "Ajouter des bananes à vos smoothies pourrait faire plus de mal que de bien", tranche le spécialiste. "Si vous souhaitez sérieusement optimiser votre santé et votre nutrition, vous devez reconsidérer cet ingrédient populaire". Les bananes n'en restent pas moins intéressantes pour la santé, elles sont riches en fibres, en potassium, en vitamine B6 et en vitamine C mais pour profiter de leurs bienfaits, il vaut mieux les manger autrement. Savez-vous déjà que ce sont les bananes mûres qui augmentent le plus le taux de sucre dans le sang ? Pour 100 g de fruits, les bananes mûres contiennent 12 g de sucre et un index glycémique s'élevant à 55. A l'inverse, une banane verte possède un index glycémique de 35. Choisir une banane verte ou jaune clair (sans marron) pour le petit-déjeuner peut ainsi être meilleur pour stabiliser la glycémie. Que vous la mangiez seule, dans un fromage blanc ou en smoothie.

author: Evelyn Ruiz
title: Tomás Yarrington es deportado de Estados Unidos a México
text:
Tomás Yarrington, ex gobernador de Tamaulipas, fue deportado de Estados Unidos a México la mañana de hoy miércoles 9 de abril.
Autoridades de Estados Unidos entregaron al gobierno de México a Tomás Yarrington, a través de la Fiscalía General de la República (FGR) con sede en Baja California.
Tomás Yarrington enfrentaba una condena en Estados Unidos de 9 años de cárcel tras ser declarado culpable de lavado de dinero para el narcotráfico en 2021.
Estados Unidos entrega a Tomás Yarrington a México; es trasladado a CDMX
La entrega de Tomás Yarrington por parte de Estados Unidos a México se realizó vía terrestre por la frontera San Diego-Tijuana.
Primeramente el ex gobernador de Tamaulipas fue llevado a las oficinas de la FGR en Baja California para el trámite de su certificación médica; tras ello, Tomás Yarrington fue trasladado a la CDMX.
No obstante, fuentes del gobierno federal aseguran que Tomás Yarrington ya se encuenta en el penal del Altiplano en el Estado de México.
A principios de 2024, la FGR solicitó una orden de aprehensión en contra de Tomás Yarrington acusado de dos delitos en México.
Sin embargo, una jueza de Procesos Penales Federales con sede en el Estado de México rechazó la solicitud por “deficiencias existentes” que la FGR tendría que subsanar antes.
¿De qué es acusado Tomás Yarrington?
Tomás Yarrington fue acusado de facilitar el tráfico de drogas del Cártel del Golfo y Los Zetas en Estados Unidos entre 2007 y 2009, así como de recibir millones de dólares del narcotráfico.
A pesar de que recibió sentencia en 2021, las autoridades de Estados Unidos determinaron tomar en cuenta el tiempo que ya llevaba preso, desde que fue arrestado en Italia en 2017.
El Buró Federal de Prisiones de Estados Unidos señala que Tomás Yarrington salió libre el 3 de julio de 2024, de manera que únicamente cumplió 3 años en prisión en el país estadounidense.
Por otra parte, las autoridades de México buscan juzgarlo por la comisión de dos delitos:
- operaciones con recursos de procedencia ilícita
- delitos contra la salud
Tomás Yarrington se desempeñó como gobernador de Tamaulipas por el PRI en el periodo de 1999 a 2004.

author: CNN
title: Hamas accepts Gaza ceasefire proposal from Egypt and Qatar
text:
Hamas accepts Gaza ceasefire proposal from Egypt and Qatar
CNN
By Abeer Salman, Christian Edwards, Becky Anderson and Jeremy Diamond, CNN
(CNN) — Hamas says it has accepted a ceasefire deal proposed by Egypt and Qatar which seeks to halt the seven-month war with Israel in
Gaza.
In a statement Monday, Hamas said the head of its political bureau, Ismail Haniyeh, told the Qatari prime minister and Egyptian intelligence minister that the militant group had accepted their proposal.
The Israeli government is now reviewing the Hamas response, CNN has learned. The Israeli prime minister’s office has declined to comment at this stage.
It’s unclear whether Hamas has agreed to the most recent ceasefire proposal, as outlined last week, or a revised version of it.
The most recent framework, which Israel helped craft but has not fully agreed to, calls for the release of between 20 and 33 hostages over several weeks in exchange for a temporary ceasefire and the release of Palestinian prisoners.
After the initial exchange, according to that framework, there would follow what sources describe as the “restoration of sustainable calm” during which the remaining hostages, captive Israeli soldiers and the bodies of hostages would be exchanged for more Palestinian prisoners.
A diplomatic source familiar with the talks told CNN that after a day-long meeting in Doha, Qatar’s capital, between CIA Director William Burns and Qatari Prime Minister Sheikh Mohammed bin Abdulrahman Al Thani, mediators convinced Hamas to accept a three-part deal.
“The bill is now firmly in (Israeli Prime Minister) Benjamin Netanyahu’s court,” the source said.
The United States is also reviewing Hamas’ response and “discussing it with our partners in the region,” State Department Matthew Miller said.
“We continue to believe that a hostage deal is in the best interests of the Israeli people. It’s in the best interest of the Palestinian people. It would bring an immediate ceasefire, it would allow increased movement of humanitarian assistance and so we’re going to continue to work to try to reach one,” he said.
As news spread in Gaza of Hamas’ announcement, Palestinians began to celebrate in the street in Deir al-Balah, in the center of the Strip, and Gaza City in the north.
The news comes just hours after Israel
ordered Palestinians living in Rafah, a city in southern Gaza, to “evacuate immediately.”
The order raised fears that Israel’s long-threatened assault on the city could be imminent. More than 1 million Palestinians have fled to Rafah, where Hamas is believed to have regrouped after Israel’s destruction of much of the north of Gaza.
A source familiar with Israeli plans told CNN that a limited incursion into Rafah was intended to keep pressure on Hamas to agree a deal that would bring about a ceasefire and a hostage release.
IDF operations ongoing
Asked whether Hamas’ acceptance of a deal could change Israel’s plans for Rafah, Israel Defense Forces (IDF) spokesperson Daniel Hagari said the military would continue to operate in Gaza. He said operations are ongoing, but that the IDF is making every effort in the negotiations to bring the hostages home as “fast as possible.”
Netanyahu has come under fierce pressure from the more extreme wing of his coalition not to accept the ceasefire proposal outlined last week, and to focus instead on destroying Hamas in Rafah.
Orit Strook, Israel’s settlements minister and a member of the far-right Religious Zionism party, said last week that accepting the deal would “throw” Israel’s military progress “in the trash.”
Itamar Ben Gvir, Israel’s national security minister, said Netanyahu had “promised that Israel would enter Rafah, assured that the war would not end, and pledged that there would be no reckless deal.”
But large parts of the Israeli public have demanded Netanyahu accept a deal. Families and supporters of the hostages blocked the Ayalon Highway in Tel Aviv last week, holding a banner reading: “Rafah or the hostages – choose life.”
Benny Gantz, a member of Israel’s war cabinet but seen as a rival and possible successor to Netanyahu, said the return of hostages was more urgent that entering Rafah.
This is a developing story and will be updated.
The-CNN-Wire
™ & © 2024 Cable News Network, Inc., a Warner Bros. Discovery Company. All rights reserved.
CNN’s Oren Liebermann, Jennifer Hansler and Lauren Izso contributed reporting.

author: Redacción Cómo
title: El amuleto que se debe tener en la casa para atraer el dinero
text: En la búsqueda constante de prosperidad y abundancia, muchas personas recurren a diversas prácticas y creencias para atraer la riqueza a sus vidas. Una de las tradiciones más antiguas y extendidas es el uso de amuletos, objetos que se cree poseen poderes mágicos y protectoras. Los amuletos han sido parte de las culturas de todo el mundo desde tiempos inmemoriales. Su uso se remonta a civilizaciones antiguas que buscaban protección y buena fortuna en sus vidas cotidianas. En la actualidad, la creencia en la eficacia de los amuletos sigue viva, y uno de los más codiciados es el amuleto de la prosperidad. Tiene sus raíces en diversas tradiciones culturales y es conocido por diferentes nombres en diferentes lugares. Sin embargo, independientemente de la cultura, su propósito principal es atraer la abundancia y el dinero a la vida de aquellos que lo poseen .Aunque no tiene un origen específico, ya que diferentes culturas han desarrollado sus propias versiones a lo largo de los siglos. Sin embargo, hay ciertos elementos comunes que se encuentran en muchos de estos amuletos. Uno de ellos es la representación de símbolos de la suerte, como monedas, lingotes de oro, billetes de banco u otros elementos asociados con la riqueza material. En la cultura china, por ejemplo, el amuleto de la prosperidad a menudo toma la forma de una rana de tres patas llamada Chan Chu. Se cree que esta rana atrae la fortuna y la riqueza a aquellos que la poseen. En otras culturas, el amuleto puede ser una representación de la diosa de la fortuna, un trébol de cuatro hojas o incluso un elefante con la trompa levantada, símbolo de buena suerte en muchas tradiciones asiáticas.La diversidad de estos amuletos resalta la universalidad del deseo humano de buscar la prosperidad y la riqueza. A medida que nos sumergimos en las diferentes interpretaciones culturales, surge la pregunta crucial: ¿realmente estos amuletos poseen algún poder especial o son simplemente símbolos que refuerzan nuestras creencias y actitudes hacia el dinero? Aunque la eficacia sobrenatural de los amuletos sigue siendo objeto de debate, algunos psicólogos sugieren que el poder de estos objetos puede radicar en su capacidad para influir en nuestras mentes y emociones. La psicología de la prosperidad juega un papel importante en cómo percibimos el dinero y nuestras posibilidades de obtenerlo. El simple acto de poseer un amuleto de la prosperidad puede afectar positivamente nuestra mentalidad. Al creer que estamos rodeados de símbolos de prosperidad, es posible que nos sintamos más seguros, enfocados y motivados para buscar oportunidades financieras. Este efecto placebo, aunque no garantiza un aumento tangible en la riqueza, puede tener un impacto significativo en nuestras decisiones y acciones relacionadas con el dinero. ¿Cómo elegir y utilizar un amuleto de la prosperidad?Con la variedad de amuletos disponibles en el mercado, la elección de uno puede resultar abrumadora. Sin embargo, hay ciertos principios a considerar al seleccionar y utilizar un amuleto de la prosperidad. Desde la autenticidad de los materiales hasta la conexión personal con el símbolo, cada detalle cuenta en la búsqueda de la atracción del dinero. *Este artículo fue creado con ayuda de una inteligencia artificial que utiliza machine learning para producir texto similar al humano, y curado por un periodista especializado de Semana.

author: Rhys Jones
title: SWAT rip open truck cabin with robot ending hours-long police standoff
text: [Independent TV](/tv) Showing now | News 00:59 SWAT robot rips open truck cabin ending hours-long police standoff [Police](/topic/police) in [Houston](/topic/houston), [Texas](/topic/texas), were forced to use an armoured battering to open the cabin of an 18-wheeler truck after a bizarre standoff caused traffic backups for several hours on Wednesday, 27 December. The Harris County Sheriff’s Office has since identified the driver as Trinidad Cutshall and said he will be charged with felony evading. Police stopped the truck, which was moving slowly along the East Freeway, but the driver refused to exit the vehicle, according to ABC Affiliate KTRK, They can be seen prying open the cabin with a vehicle known as a ‘rook’, before using gan canisters and a police dog to subdue the driver. Aerial footage shows the [SWAT](/topic/swat) team dragging the driver out of the cabin, who was then placed on a gurney and treated for minor injuries. author: Empresa Peruana de Servicios Editoriales S. A. EDITORA PERÚ
title: Cambio climático: fuertes tormentas y olas de calor dejan once muertos en Australia | Noticias | Agencia Peruana de Noticias Andina
text:
Australia afronta el último fin de semana del año y la celebración de Año Nuevo entre avisos de fuertes tormentas en el este del país, que ya han dejado once muertos, y olas de calor en el oeste y norte de la nación oceánica.
Temperaturas extremas en el oeste
Según el último pronóstico del Departamento de Climatología, la ciudad de Marble Bar, en el estado de Australia Occidental, podría alcanzar los 49 grados Celsius este sábado.
Una ola de calor que también se registrará en otras jurisdicciones del país y que ha llevado a las autoridades a mantenerse en alerta ante la posibilidad de que se produzcan incendios forestales.
Este golpe de calor en pleno verano austral coincide con nuevas tormentas previstas para los orientales estados de Queensland y Nueva Gales del Sur, que proseguirán hasta el lunes.
Fuertes lluvias y vientos Conforme al organismo oficial, algunas de estas tormentas traerán lluvias torrenciales y vientos de más de 90 kilómetros por hora.
A mediados de mes, además, el norte del país sintió el golpe del ciclón Jasper, de categoría 2, que dejó grandes inundaciones en algunas zonas del Territorio Norte.
Este verano austral, que discurre entre diciembre y febrero, se encuentra bajo la influencia del fenómeno El Niño, que generalmente provoca temperaturas superiores a la media y se asocia a condiciones extremas que pueden hacer brotar incendios forestales, la llegada de ciclones y sequía.
Lea también: ¿Cómo reciclar en Perú? Más de 900 recicladores son capacitados para mejorar sus acciones
Más en Andina
?? Para prevenir efectos del fenómeno de El Niño, personal de la Autoridad para la Reconstrucción con Cambios (ARCC) culminó las acciones rápidas para limpiar, descolmatar y conformar diques en la quebrada Cabuyal, región Tumbes.
